meanings.definition: To make a mess or mistake of something.
meanings.sent1: I ballsed up the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent2: She always ballses up her room before cleaning it.
meanings.sent3: I ballsed up the surprise party by telling her too early.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to fix the leak only ballsed things up even more.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick ballsed up, revealing the hidden compartment.

meanings.sent1: The rain ballsed our picnic plans.
meanings.sent2: He ballsed the painting by accidentally spilling paint on it.
meanings.sent3: The cat ballsed up the neatly arranged books by knocking them over.
meanings.sent4: The noisy neighbors ballsed up our peaceful evening.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind ballsed up the carefully arranged decorations.

meanings.sent1: I ballsed the exam because I didn't study enough.
meanings.sent2: She ballsed the presentation by forgetting her lines.
meanings.sent3: The team ballsed up the game by missing easy shots.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to fix the car engine ballsed up, causing more problems.
meanings.sent5: The plan ballsed up when they forgot the key ingredient.
